ovdesc.p: The Statement Format table identifies the statement format id from the Statement format name attached to a particular posting line.

desc.p: Text (as it is) to be displayed in the statement line. This is only applicable if
Tag61Indicator is not equal to Y
Used for internal purpose.Holds the ID of the previous live record of store table PP.STATEMENT.FORMAT. This field can hold upto 65 alphanumeric characters.
No Input field

Contains all the override messages which the user agreed to during Input. During the validation of a transaction, the system may provide the user with a series of screen override messages to indicate an anomaly.
Record Activation Code generated for the record by the payment's hub.
Possible values:
N - Not active
A - Active
H-YYYYMMDDHHMMSSsss - History. Where: YYYY - year, MM - month, DD - day, HH - hour, MM - minutes, SS - seconds and sss - miliseconds.
F - Future
C - Not active future
Validation Rules:
19 alphanumeric characters.
The value is not editable by the user.
Record Status Code generated for the record by the payments hub.
Possible values:
L - Live
U - Unapproved
R - Reversed
MF - Modified future
Validation Rules:
1 alphanumeric character.
The value is not editable by the user.
As a statement format can have multiple statement lines, Sequence Number is
used to order the statement lines within the statement format .
In case Tag61Indicator is Y, then this can only have value as Subtag7, Subtag8
or Subtag9 indicating for which subtag within tag61 this is applicable.
In all other cases it will be a number and Statement lines should be sorted based
on this sequence number and sequence number can be edited by operator.
Specifies the date from which the record is to be considered as active for payments processing.
Start Position of the above token in the statement Line .
For a statement line with no literal text but only has a token defined and if the
token value has to be left justified then the value of this field should be 1 in the
table. This is only applicable if Tag61Indicator is not equal to Y
Unique generated ID used as primary key
The Statement format name to identify the set of statement lines attached to a
statement format
This name is set up by the user using the GUI
Used for internal purpose. Value of this field determines values of fields, 'RAC' and 'RSC'
Possible values:
N - New
M - Modified
R - Reverse
This field can hold upto 1 alphanumeric character and the value is not editable by the user.
Unique Number in the Table
This sequence number is hidden from the GUI and created by the database
Any token from the following token Tables
• Amount Token Table
• Date Token Table
• Statement Text Token Table
This field indicates if the record is applicable for Tag61 mapping in MT940
statement. If yes, then Sequence field would indicate the Subtag within Tag61
for which this value is applicable.
The format in which the amount and rate token value must be displayed
This is only applicable if Tag61Indicator is not equal to Y
Y: If the token value is blank or 0 , the statement line is not displayed
N: If the token value is blank or 0 , the statement line will be displayed
This is only applicable if Tag61Indicator is not equal to Y
Indicates the company ID for which the record is created.
Example : BNK,GB1

Specifies the date until which the record is to be considered as active for payments processing.Post this date, the record will be set as Inactive by the payments hub.
Standard T24 alphanumeric field.
Validation Rules
A maximum of 15 characters may be entered.
Language in which statement line is generated. This can be wild carded (*)
which will match with any language.
Y: Default Value :Statement Lines exceeding 65 140 characters will be displayed
in the next line
N: If a statement line is longer than 65 140 characters , the rest of the
characters are truncated
